trans-unit.source: Enables the instantiation of a tree of <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement"></xref> and/or <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement"></xref> objects.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkTemplate"></xref> class.
Finds the element associated with the specified name defined within this template.
For more information, see "XAML Namescopes in Styles and Templates" in [WPF XAML Namescopes](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The string name.
The context of the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement"></xref> where this template is applied.
The element associated with the specified name.
Gets a value that indicates whether this template has optimized content.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this template has optimized content; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether this object is in an immutable state so it cannot be changed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true " name="true " href=""></xref>if this object is in an immutable state; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Loads the content of the template as an instance of an object and returns the root element of the content.
The root element of the content.
Calling this multiple times returns separate instances.
Registers a new name/object pair into the current name scope.
For more information, see "XAML Namescopes in Styles and Templates" in [WPF XAML Namescopes](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The name to register.
The object to be mapped to the provided name.
Gets or sets the collection of resources that can be used within the scope of this template.
The resources that can be used within the scope of this template.
Locks the template so it cannot be changed.
Returns a value that indicates whether serialization processes should serialize the value of the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkTemplate.Resources*> property on instances of this class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.XamlDesignerSerializationManager"></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkTemplate.Resources*> property value should be serialized; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns a value that indicates whether serialization processes should serialize the value of the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkTemplate.VisualTree*> property on instances of this class.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkTemplate.VisualTree*> property value should be serialized; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns an object that has the provided identifying name.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkTemplate> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.INameScope> interface.
The name identifier for the object being requested.
The object, if found.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if no object of that name was found.
Queries whether a specified ambient property is available in the current scope.
The name of the requested ambient property.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the requested ambient property is available; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a reference to the object that records or plays the XAML nodes for the template when the template is defined or applied by a writer.
A reference to the object that records or plays the XAML nodes for the template.
Removes a name/object mapping from the XAML namescope.
For more information, see "XAML Namescopes in Styles and Templates" in [WPF XAML Namescopes](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The name of the mapping to remove.
When overridden in a derived class, supplies rules for the element this template is applied to.
The base implementation specifies that the templated parent must be a non-null <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement>.
The element this template is applied to.
Gets or sets the root node of the template.
## XAML Property Element Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *VisualTreeRootNode* A single XAML element as the immediate child of the subclass.
Templates must have a single root node.
In order to generate a useful template, the element chosen as *VisualTreeRootNode* is expected to support a content model of its own, often a model that supports multiple child elements.
*VisualTreeNodeContents* One or more elements that complete the intended template.
If the element chosen as *VisualTreeRootNode* only supports a single child, then there can only be one element declared as *VisualTreeNodeContents*.
It is also possible (though uncommon) to provide text content if the chosen *VisualTreeRootNode* supports a text content property.
The root node of the template.
